intro: Crotalaria axillaris, commonly known as the narrowleaf false pigeonwings, is a herbaceous annual plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its legume pods and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in slender, cylindrical pods that split open when mature to release the seeds. Crotalaria axillaris is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
